Life-threatening if pH < 7.10 or bicarbonaemia < 8 mmol/L: reduced cardiac and tissue output, dyspnoea, catecholamine resistance, ventricular arrhythmias, inhibition of cellular metabolism and coma.

properties.question: What is the primary indicator of severe acid-base imbalance?
properties.option_c: A decrease in serum calcium levels
properties.option_d: A decrease in serum potassium levels
